meanings.definition: A blow that renders a person unconscious.
meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered a knockout punch to his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The knockout in the boxing match was unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The knockout punch made the boxer take an unplanned nap.
meanings.sent4: Her singing was a knockout, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The knockout blow left him lying on the mat, motionless.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is very attractive or impressive.
meanings.sent1: She looked like a knockout in her elegant dress.
meanings.sent2: The new sports car was a real knockout.
meanings.sent3: The dessert was a knockout, everyone wanted seconds.
meanings.sent4: His knockout smile charmed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent5: The sunset over the ocean was a knockout sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: The boxer tried to knockout his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent2: He managed to knockout the intruder with a swift hit.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she could knockout anyone in a pillow fight.
meanings.sent4: The sudden realization seemed to knockout his senses.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise seemed to knockout his ability to focus.

meanings.sent1: The team was determined to knockout their rivals in the final game.
meanings.sent2: The chess grandmaster managed to knockout all his opponents.
meanings.sent3: The debate champion could knockout any argument with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her brilliant strategy was enough to knockout the competition.
meanings.sent5: The new technology could knockout the old ways of doing things.
